results.title: A Justice Dept. in Turmoil Moves to Dismiss Eric Adams’s Corruption Case
results.abstract: New York City’s mayor was accused of bribery, fraud and soliciting illegal foreign campaign donations. President Trump’s administration wants him free to help with mass deportations.
results.byline: By Benjamin Weiser, William K. Rashbaum and Jonah E. Bromwich

multimedia.caption: Mayor Eric Adams faces corruption charges. The government has asked a judge for permission to put the case on hold.

results.title: A Rupture on the Right Over Prosecutors, Politics and the Rule of Law
results.abstract: Differing interpretations of Attorney General Robert H. Jackson’s classic 1940 speech, “The Federal Prosecutor,” figured in Thursday’s showdown in the Eric Adams case.
results.byline: By Adam Liptak

multimedia.caption: “The prosecutor has more control over life, liberty and reputation than any other person in America,” Robert H. Jackson said in 1940 while serving as attorney general.
“The prosecutor has more control over life, liberty and reputation than any other person in America,” Robert H. Jackson said in 1940 while serving as attorney general.

results.title: Judges Generally Let Prosecutors Drop Charges. Maybe Not for Adams.
results.abstract: Judge Dale E. Ho will weigh the request after the resignation of Manhattan’s U.S. attorney and her accusations of misconduct.
results.byline: By Benjamin Weiser and Jonah E. Bromwich

results.title: Layoffs Expand at Federal Agencies, Part of Trump Purge
results.abstract: Mass firings have rocked multiple agencies as President Trump and Elon Musk ramp up plans to drastically slash and reshape the federal work force.

results.title: Judge Refuses to Immediately Reinstate Inspectors General Fired by Trump
results.abstract: Judge Ana C. Reyes, a Biden appointee, excoriated lawyers representing the former government watchdogs for how they handled their emergency request, but let the lawsuit proceed on a slower timeline.

results.title: High Above Chernobyl, Workers Grapple With Ice, Fire and Nuclear Fears
results.abstract: After an apparent drone strike blew a hole in the protective shell, there is an urgent need to patch what covers the wreckage of the world’s worst nuclear accident.
results.byline: By Kim Barker and Brendan Hoffman

multimedia.caption: The breach at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant was dangerous for many reasons, mainly because it jeopardized the safety of the protective shell covering Reactor No. 4.

results.title: JD Vance Has a TikTok Problem. Can He Find a Solution?

results.title: The Sierra Nevada Just Had an ‘Epic Snow Day’
results.abstract: The mountain range straddling California and Nevada has had mostly warm storms this winter. Finally, a cold one has piled up multiple feet of snow.

results.title: A Plunge Into the Pacific on a Day of Mudslides
results.abstract: Southern California took stock on Friday of the damage from an intense bout of rain. Among the most dramatic scenes: a Fire Department vehicle that was swept to the sea.

results.title: Eleanor Maguire, Memory Expert Who Studied London Cabbies, Dies at 54

results.title: Rafter Is Briefly ‘Swallowed’ by Whale in Chile, as His Father Films
results.abstract: Paddling in the Strait of Magellan, Adrián Simancas was caught in a humpback’s lunge. “I realized that I was in something’s mouth and I had been eaten,” he said.
results.byline: By John Bartlett and Alan Yuhas

results.title: Inside Fashion’s Mysterious Silly Hat Festival
results.abstract: How a tradition that started off as a way to find a partner became a day for the industry to celebrate itself.
